title: Flexbox Sticky Footer
preview: Back in the days of floats and jQuery there were all sorts of hacks that were used to stick your footer at the end of the page if your content didn’t push it to the bottom.

title: 3 Common Mistakes I see people use in Rx and the Observable Pattern
preview: Maybe you haven’t heard of Observables, but they’re amazeballs. They’re like Promises, only they can resolve more then once, and can easily be mapped, debounced, merged and zipped.

title: Creating Mock Data for Jasmine Spec and Protractor E2E Tests in Typescript / Angular2
preview: If you want to create test or mock data for your specs, structure is completely up to you. There are two methods I’ve used, each with their own pros and cons.

title: Simple Observable Unit Testing in Angular2
preview: When you’re writing unit tests for your angular2 components, and you throw observables into the mix, things can get complicated fast. Some people go the more complicated route, faking responses from the actual service itself — but on the component level I feel this can get overly complicated.

title: Angular2 FormBuilder Unit Tests
preview: If you are using formbuilder, you may wonder, okay, now how do I create tests for my component that uses Formbuilder. Currently, this is how I am accomplishing this.

title: Angular2 Multipart forms with Component Interaction, Async Operations, and Validation
preview: If you have to work with large, behemoth forms in Angular2, and want to split those forms out into child components, this can get complicated fast...

title: Custom Angular2 Form Components using FormBuilder
preview: If you’re using FormBuilder in Angular2 and are having problems getting everything to work, wondering why why dear God there’s no documentation on how to accomplish such a thing, look no further.

title: If we want to find love that lasts, we need to stop blaming our shit on our smartphone.
preview: There seems to be this idea going around lately that love is incredibly hard to find in the age of social media and smartphones, or at least harder then it used to be. Facebook, instagram, pinterest, and tinder (but especially tinder) are making it impossible to just settle down with someone and stay settled down.

title: Dreams of a Red Horizon Book Cover
preview: This is the cover for a literary project I recently finished that's still currently seeking representation. Created in Illustrator CS6. Still playing around with typefaces. .

title: Metro Wordpress Theme
preview: My gol with 'Metro, as it was previously known' was to mockup a wordpress theme inspired by the Windows 'Modern' (previously known as 'Metro') look for Windows 8...

title: Artifex Touch Branding & Web
preview: This is the work that I did during an internship in the summer of my junior year of college.

title: Stromae Ad Campaign
preview: For a graphic design class, I was instructed to create a full advertising campaign, including a Magazine Cover, a flyer, a T-Shirt and a billboard. Based on the assignment, I decided to create a campaign for a fictional concert of the musician Stromae in New York City. What you see below is the fruit of these efforts.

title: Dreams of a Red Horizon
preview: You can read the first half of my still unpublished first novel, Dreams of a Red Horizon on Wattpad (for now).
